result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles K Chapman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 1 day if revoked.
Concurrent with: with Dunn County case 21CF276.

miscConds.notes:
Absolute sobriety.
Not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores - any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
PAY DIRECT TO CLERK OF COURTS, ANY BOND POSTED MAY BE APPLIED

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles K Chapman

records.addlTxt:
11:33 AM Defendant Charles K Chapman in court, in custody from the DCJ.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Charles K Chapman.  Attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for State of Wisconsin. A. Standaert - Clerk 

State - makes argument for sentence recommendation of 9 months jail (agrees with DOC's recommendation), notes jail credit of 110 days
Atty Erdman - agrees with jail credit of 110 days, makes argument for sentence of credit for time served
Deft - makes statement to the Court
Court - orders deft to credit for time served
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 14, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:31 PM Prosecuting attorney Lucas D Arras in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Charles K Chapman in court.  Attorney Nicole M Homer in court for Charles K Chapman. A. Standaert - Clerk 

21CM337, 22CM39

Atty Homer - deft will enter plea to Ct 1 22CM39 - 1 year probation-concurrent to any other probation sentence, absolute sobriety, AODA  and follow through, follow recommendations of agent, CC $463 - 21CM337 dismissed and read-in
State - agrees that is the joint recommendation, in compliance with victim's rights
Defendant - enters a no contest plea to 22CM39, waives rights & JT
Parties stip that facts support the plea.

Court - finds waiver of rights & plea voluntary, free & knowing & approves stip by parties to facts
Accepts no contest plea to 22CM39 and finds defendant guilty 

State - makes argument, asks Court to accept joint agreement
Atty Homer - makes argument, also asks Court to accept joint agreement
Deft - makes statement to the Court

Court orders -
  22CM39
    - Sentence withheld, 1 year probation (concurrent to 21CF276)
         - Absolute sobriety
         - May not enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores - any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol
         - Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations
         - Follow recommendations of agent
         - Pay court costs of $463 - 60 dtp or pp
         - Credit for 1 day if revoked

Dismissed and read-in: 21CM337

2:56 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Charles K Chapman in court.  Attorney Nicole M Homer in court for Charles K Chapman. A. Standaert - Clerk 

21CM337, 22CM39

Atty Homer - rec'd offer, in agreement with it
Court - schedules plea/sent hearing
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 26, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

01:31 PM Defendant Charles K Chapman appeared by video means from the Dunn County Jail. Prosecuting Atty Amber L Hahn appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Shelly Tomtschik appears by Zoom.  A. Standaert - Clerk
State - requesting $500 sign bond and absolute sobreity, not to possess drug paraphernalia
Court - orders $500 sign bond, absolute sobriety

Atty Tomtschik -   Deft waives reading & speedy trial
        pleads not guilty
Court - schedules return  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
